file_name: smartrxsystemsinc_20180914_1-a_ex1a-6 mat ctrct_11351705_ex1a-6 mat ctrct_distributor agreement.pdf

perturbation.original_text: Territory shall mean Exclusivity for the state of Texas, USA, and Exclusive Distribution opportunities in all other states (with either the Company or Distributor), except the state of Florida.
perturbation.changed_text: Territory shall mean Exclusivity for the state of Texas, USA. Exclusive Distribution opportunities in all other states (with either the Company or Distributor). Company also maintains the right to appoint other distributors within the state of Texas.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants exclusive distributorship to A3 Development Group in Texas. The modification introduces the possibility that the Company can appoint other distributors in Texas, directly contradicting the exclusivity provision and creating uncertainty about the extent of A3's exclusive rights.

perturbation.original_text: Company will pay Distributor (or its Assignee) Ten Percent (10%) of the Master Distributor Override generated by each Customer Kiosk Location. (Master Distributor Override ("MDO") shall mean Total Revenue per Customer Kiosk Location collected by SRXS from third party payors and patient cash payments). This 10% of the total revenue generated is payable only if the EBITDA is a positive EBITDA and exceeds the 10% of the revenue. In cases of a positive EBITDA but shortage of funds compared to the 10% of the revenue, Distributor will take less than 10%. If the EBITDA is negative, no payments will be made to Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text: Company will pay Distributor (or its Assignee) Ten Percent (10%) of the Master Distributor Override generated by each Customer Kiosk Location. (Master Distributor Override ("MDO") shall mean Total Revenue per Customer Kiosk Location collected by SRXS from third party payors and patient cash payments). The exact percentage of the total revenue, and its disbursement schedule, will be determined by the Company based on performance metrics and profitability assessments, and are subject to change at the Company's discretion with 30 days' notice to the distributor.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a clear payment structure. The modified version introduces ambiguity by stating that the Company can alter the percentage and disbursement schedule based on unspecified 'performance metrics and profitability assessments.' This contradicts the initial commitment to a fixed percentage and creates uncertainty about the distributor's actual earnings.

perturbation.original_text: All such arbitration proceedings shall be administered by the AAA and held in Dallas, Texas. The parties agree that the decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding as to each of them.
perturbation.changed_text: All such arbitration proceedings shall be administered by the AAA. The location of the proceedings will be at the Company's discretion. While the parties intend for the arbitrator's decision to be binding, either party may seek judicial review if they believe the arbitrator acted outside the scope of their authority or made a gross error of law.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates binding arbitration in Dallas, Texas. The modified text allows the company to choose the arbitration location and introduces the option of judicial review, contradicting the binding nature of the arbitration agreement and creating uncertainty about the finality of any arbitration decision.
